notes: Mild elevations may occur in infection, inflammation, trauma.
High-sensitivity CRP (hs-CRP) is used for cardiovascular risk stratification.

interferences.name: Biotin
interferences.note: High biotin may interfere with certain immunoassays

notes: <1.0 low CVD risk, 1.0–3.0 average, >3.0 high (context dependent).
Interpret with clinical correlation and local baseline titers.
Rising titer on paired samples is more significant than a single value.
Slide method is qualitative screening; tube method allows semi-quantitative titers.
Significant titer thresholds vary; many labs consider "≥ 1:160" significant locally.
NS1 antigen positivity suggests early infection.
IgM suggests recent infection; IgG alone may indicate past exposure.
Trace–3+ semi-quantitative; correlate with specific gravity and clinical context.
Often estimated by TG/5 (mg/dL) when TG < 400 mg/dL.
